channel.title: Good ::message command?
channel.description: does anyone know how to make the ::message command say in rank's [Mod]-[Name] Says.. ect ect.

item.title: Good ::message command?
item.dc:creator: @spy_man47 spy man47
item.description:
@spy_man47 wrote:

Here is a Good One 

    if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && muted == false) {
String text = command.substring(5);
if (playerRights == 1 && playerLevel[16] >= 4) {
	yell("[Mod]-[" +playerName+"] Says : " +command.substring(5));
} else if (playerRights == 2) {
	yell("[Admin]-[" +playerName+"] Says : " +command.substring(5));
} else if (playerRights == 3) {
	yell("[Owner]-[" +playerName+"] Says : " +command.substring(5));
} else if (donator == 1) {
	yell("[Donator]-[" +playerName+"] Says : " +command.substring(5));
} else if (playerRights == 3 && donator == 1 ) {
	yell("[Owner/Donator]-[" +playerName+"]: " +command.substring(5));
}

}

Read full topic

item.title: Good ::message command?
item.dc:creator: @bloodmaniet bloodmaniet
item.description:
@bloodmaniet wrote:

[quote=“HiddenPker, post:1, topic:307196”]does anyone know how to make the ::message command say in rank’s [Mod]-[Name] Says…
ect ect.[/quote]

} if (command.startsWith("talk") && command.length() > 8 && playerRights >= 0) { String text = command.substring(8); yell("player-"+playerName+": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); }

[code]}

    if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 8 && playerRights >= 2) {
		String text = command.substring(8);
			yell("Admin-"+playerName+":  " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));

}[/code]

if (command.startsWith("server") && command.length() > 8 && playerRights >= 1) { String text = command.substring(8); yell("Mod-"+playerName+": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); }

if (command.startsWith("message") && command.length() > 8 && playerRights >= 3) { String text = command.substring(8); yell("Owner-"+playerName+": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1)); }

Read full topic

item.title: Good ::message command?
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

Something I just typed up (not tested, there's probably an error somewhere)

Code:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“yell”) && command.length() > 5) {
switch(playerRights) {
case 0:
yell("[Player]"+playerName+": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
break;

case 1:
yell("[Mod]"+playerName+": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
break;

case 2:
yell("[Admin]"+playerName+": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
break;

case 3:
yell("[Owner]"+playerName+": " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
break;
}
}

You also might want to make it so muted players can’t use it.

Add this in for muted part:

if (muted == 1) { sendMessage("You are muted and are unable to use the yell command!");

Read full topic

item.title: Good ::message command?
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

Agh. Well I wrote it in like 2 minutes, and its kinda my first command, most commands I have I just copied from other peoples, and configured it to my server. But, you think you could supply me with a correct code for this, that checks the player rights, so the command is the same for all players, but it don’t take up a lot of space.

Read full topic

item.title: Good ::message command?
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

if (command.startsWith("message") && command.length() > 6 
if (checkLog("+playerName+.txt")) {
character-rights = 0 = true;
yell("[Player]"+playerName+":  " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
}
else
character-rights = 1 = true;
yell("[Member]"+playerName+":  " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
}
else
character-rights = 2 = true;
yell("[Admin]"+playerName+":  " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
}
else
character-rights = 3 = true;
yell("[Owner]"+playerName+":  " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
}

command.length() > 6 should be command.length() > 8

character-rights = # = true; should just simply be if(playerRights >= #) {. Plus, character-rights = # = true; isn’t an if statement so it would never work.

What’s the checkLog checking? The parameters for it are checkLog(String file, String playerName). How does it know to check in the character files? Plus, the checkLog method directs you to all files in the ‘config’ folder. Unless you delete the part of the code that directs you into the ‘config’ folder, checkLog("+playerName+.txt") will never work. Your logic is correct, but the command is off by a mile.

Read full topic

item.title: Good ::message command?
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

[quote=“runefreak10, post:8, topic:307196”][quote author=GrimReapersScythe link=topic=403324.msg2987193#msg2987193 date=1255060726]
This probably wont work, because I’m not sure how the checklog method would be, if anyone wants to use it go ahead. If you can get it to work, it will be a very clean way of scripting the messages for everyone. Also, if anyone does get this to work, please let me know.

if (command.startsWith("message") && command.length() > 6 
if (checkLog("+playerName+.txt")) {
character-rights = 0 = true;
yell("[Player]"+playerName+":  " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
}
else
character-rights = 1 = true;
yell("[Member]"+playerName+":  " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
}
else
character-rights = 2 = true;
yell("[Admin]"+playerName+":  " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
}
else
character-rights = 3 = true;
yell("[Owner]"+playerName+":  " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
}

NOTE: This is not tested, so it may work, may not. I just cba to test right now. If anyone could test, i’d greatly appreciated it.
[/quote]

That won’t work.[/quote]
Can you tell me exactly why it wouldn’t work, and supply me with a simpler method for it?

Read full topic

If you can get it to work, it will be a very clean way of scripting the messages for everyone. Also, if anyone does get this to work, please let me know.

yell("[Player]"+playerName+":  " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
}

}

NOTE: This is not tested, so it may work, may not. I just cba to test right now. If anyone could test, i’d greatly appreciated it.[/quote]

That won’t work.

John459:

[quote]To make it even more possibly organized, you might want to use a switch statement for something like that.

A switch statement is not needed for only one command.[/quote]

I mean if he wants it to say for Moderators [Mod], for Admins [Admin], and Owners [Owner], then a switch statement would be an alternative way instead of like three else if statements.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

This probably wont work, because I’m not sure how the checklog method would be, if anyone wants to use it go ahead. If you can get it to work, it will be a very clean way of scripting the messages for everyone. Also, if anyone does get this to work, please let me know.

if (command.startsWith("message") && command.length() > 6 
if (checkLog("+playerName+.txt")) {
character-rights = 0 = true;
yell("[Player]"+playerName+":  " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
}
else
character-rights = 1 = true;
yell("[Member]"+playerName+":  " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
}
else
character-rights = 2 = true;
yell("[Admin]"+playerName+":  " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
}
else
character-rights = 3 = true;
yell("[Owner]"+playerName+":  " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
}

NOTE: This is not tested, so it may work, may not. I just cba to test right now. If anyone could test, i’d greatly appreciated it.

item.title: Good ::message command?
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

Code:

if (command.startsWith(“owneryell”) && command.length() > 6 && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Luke”)){
String text = command.substring(6);
yell("[Owner] “+playerName+”: " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
}

Code:

if (command.startsWith(“modyell”) && command.length() > 6 && playerRights >= 2){
String text = command.substring(6);
yell("[Mod] “+playerName+”: " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
}

Code:

if (command.startsWith(“adminyell”) && command.length() > 6 && playerRights >= 3){
String text = command.substring(6);
yell("[Admin] “+playerName+”: " + Character.toUpperCase(text.charAt(0)) + text.substring(1));
}

NOTE My server is a modified Delta server, so you may have to configure the yell(" part of the commands, to your send message to all option. It may be something like c.sMtoAll or something similar.

Here is a much simpler and better way to do it.

if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && playerRights == 1) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "mod" + playerName + " - " + command.substring(5); } else if (playerRights == 3 { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Owner/Co" + playerName + " - " + command.substring(5); } } else if (playerRights == 2 { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "admin" + playerName + " - " + command.substring(5); } } else { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + " - " + command.substring(5); }

Read full topic
